title: Restaurant fined over 'sexist' menu given to women when they dine with men
text:

It somehow became a thing for some high-end restaurants to leave the pricing off certain items on their menus.

Removing prices is intended to demonstrate just how out of our league certain dishes are and make it more desirable to someone who is seeking a more decadent experience.

If, like us, you're more on the level of checking your online banking to know if you can afford one or two regular sides at Nando's (fino is nothing but a dream), then it's more likely to make you feel uncomfortable, ordering a glass or water and heading for the door.

One restaurant has been hit with a rather hefty fine for choosing to omit the prices from its menu - but only for women when they are dining with a man.

(Image: La Rosa Nautica/Instagram)

The famed La Rosa Nautica, built on a pier overlooking the ocean in Lima, Peru, has been accused of sexism and ordered to pay $62,000 for carrying out the practice.

When a man and woman were dining together, waiting staff would hand the woman a gold menu which would be missing the prices for the most expensive items, while the man was given a blue menu complete with all of the financial details, as reported by Fox News .

The restaurant defended the policy, arguing it allowed women 'to enjoy a romantic evening with their partner, without taking into account the cost of the services'.

The owners did not respond to a request for comment from The Associated Press but denied it should be considered discriminatory when they were hauled before a tribunal.

Authorities found La Rosa Nautica had been discriminating against women, with an official saying: "At the end of the day they are the basis of a chauvinistic construct reinforcing differences between men and women."

Following the ruling, the restaurant must also immediately begin to offer men and women the same menus (both with prices included), train staff and post a sign to say discrimination will not be tolerated.
description: La Rosa Nautica must now give women and men the same menus when they visit
